Description: Fragment of mould-made pottery vessel, probably from a ampulla flask with round body. Red-brown fabric with red margins, yellow-cream surfaces and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The fabric resembles that of Abu Mena flasks, with examples in the British Museum (Bailey 2008, 3418; Dalton 1901, 883; Buckton 1994, 124), from Alexandria (Dutilh 1904: pls 1 and 2, fig. 22; Yoyotte 1997: no. 256), dated fifth to mid-seventh century AD (Witt 2000, no. 22). The small fragment makes identification uncertain.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IE.14) (Phase 3)
